feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [laravel/framework] Laravel Framework RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Laravel Framework through 5.5.40 and 5.6.x through 5.6.29, remote code execution might occur as a result of an unserialize call on a potentially untrusted X-XSRF-TOKEN value. This involves the decrypt method in Illuminate/Encryption/Encrypter.php and PendingBroadcast in gadgetchains/Laravel/RCE/3/chain.php in phpggc. The attacker must know the application key, which normally would never occur, but could happen if the attacker previously had privileged access or successfully accomplished a previous attack.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-15133
  • https://laravel.com/docs/5.6/upgrade#upgrade-5.6.30
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153641/PHP-Laravel-Framework-Token-Unserialize-Remote-Command-Execution.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qvqm-h22r-4cp9

entry.title: [laravel/framework] Laravel Framework RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Laravel Framework through 5.5.40 and 5.6.x through 5.6.29, remote code execution might occur as a result of an unserialize call on a potentially untrusted X-XSRF-TOKEN value. This involves the decrypt method in Illuminate/Encryption/Encrypter.php and PendingBroadcast in gadgetchains/Laravel/RCE/3/chain.php in phpggc. The attacker must know the application key, which normally would never occur, but could happen if the attacker previously had privileged access or successfully accomplished a previous attack.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-15133

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qvqm-h22r-4cp9

entry.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon SQL Injection
entry.content:
Centreon 3.4.x (fixed in Centreon 18.10.0 and Centreon web 2.8.28) allows SQL Injection via the main.php searchH parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19271
  • https://documentation.centreon.com/docs/centreon/en/latest/release_notes/centreon-18.10/centreon-18.10.0.html
  • https://documentation.centreon.com/docs/centreon/en/latest/release_notes/centreon-2.8/centreon-2.8.28.html
  • http://www.rootlabs.com.br/authenticated-sql-injection-in-centreon-3-4-x/
  • https://github.com/centreon-archived/centreon/pull/6625
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-79hg-357g-rrgv

entry.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Centreon 3.4.x (fixed in Centreon 18.10.0) allows XSS via the Service field to the main.php?p=20201 URI, as demonstrated by the "Monitoring > Status Details > Services" screen.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19311
  • https://documentation.centreon.com/docs/centreon/en/latest/release_notes/centreon-18.10/centreon-18.10.0.html
  • http://www.roothc.com.br/1349-2/
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/pull/6632
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8vh5-j6xj-5953

entry.title: [symfony/symfony] Symfony CSRF Token Fixation
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in the Security component in Symfony 2.7.x before 2.7.48, 2.8.x before 2.8.41, 3.3.x before 3.3.17, 3.4.x before 3.4.11, and 4.0.x before 4.0.11. By default, a user's session is invalidated when the user is logged out. This behavior can be disabled through the invalidate_session option. In this case, CSRF tokens were not erased during logout which allowed for CSRF token fixation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-11406
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/G4XNBMFW33H47O5TZGA7JYCVLDBCXAJV/
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/UBQK7JDXIELADIPGZIOUCZKMAJM5LSBW/
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/WU5N2TZFNGXDGMXMPP7LZCWTFLENF6WH/
  • https://symfony.com/blog/cve-2018-11406-csrf-token-fixation
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4262
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g4g7-q726-v5hg

entry.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon SQL Injection
entry.content:
Centreon 3.4.x (fixed in Centreon 18.10.0 and Centreon web 2.8.24) allows SQL Injection via the searchVM parameter to the main.php?p=20408 URI.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19312
  • https://documentation.centreon.com/docs/centreon/en/latest/release_notes/centreon-18.10/centreon-18.10.0.html
  • https://documentation.centreon.com/docs/centreon/en/latest/release_notes/centreon-2.8/centreon-2.8.24.html
  • http://www.roothc.com.br/1349-2/
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/pull/6257
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/pull/6628
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5jxp-4x68-mhqc

entry.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Centreon 3.4.x (fixed in Centreon 18.10.0) has XSS via the resource name or macro expression of a poller macro.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19280
  • https://documentation.centreon.com/docs/centreon/en/latest/release_notes/centreon-18.10/centreon-18.10.0.html
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/pull/6626
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7g3c-hrc6-5v4j

entry.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon allows SNMP trap SQL Injection
entry.content:
Centreon 3.4.x (fixed in Centreon 18.10.0 and Centreon web 2.8.27) allows SNMP trap SQL Injection.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19281
  • https://documentation.centreon.com/docs/centreon/en/latest/release_notes/centreon-18.10/centreon-18.10.0.html

  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/pull/7069
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w2xf-4gg9-87wr

entry.title: [modx/revolution] MODX Revolution Incorrect Access Control vulnerability
entry.content:
MODX Revolution version <=2.6.4 contains a Incorrect Access Control vulnerability in Filtering user parameters before passing them into phpthumb class that can result in Creating file with custom a filename and content. This attack appear to be exploitable via Web request. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in commit 06bc94257408f6a575de20ddb955aca505ef6e68.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-1000207
  • https://github.com/modxcms/revolution/pull/13979
  • https://github.com/modxcms/revolution/commit/06bc94257408f6a575de20ddb955aca505ef6e68
  • https://github.com/a2u/CVE-2018-1000207
  • https://rudnkh.me/posts/critical-vulnerability-in-modx-revolution-2-6-4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m899-6mh4-mpc5

entry.title: [anchorcms/anchor-cms] Anchor CMS Logs Credentials
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in config/error.php in Anchor 0.12.3. The error log is exposed at an errors.log URI, and contains MySQL credentials if a MySQL error (such as "Too many connections") has occurred.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-7251
  • https://github.com/anchorcms/anchor-cms/issues/1247
  • https://github.com/anchorcms/anchor-cms/releases/tag/0.12.7
  • https://twitter.com/finnwea/status/965279233030393856
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/154723/Anchor-CMS-0.12.3a-Information-Disclosure.html
  • http://www.andmp.com/2018/02/advisory-assigned-CVE-2018-7251-in-anchorcms.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hxcw-pqqc-rv85

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure
entry.content:
A flaw was found in moodle before versions 3.5.1, 3.4.4, 3.3.7. No option existed to omit logs from data privacy exports, which may contain details of other users who interacted with the requester.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-10889
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-10889
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=373369
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/720d5b3b8559a97b7d6dd77351fb8d1cd8890f14
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124185814/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104733
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wmvq-q9h8-7j4g

entry.title: [october/october] October CMS Local File Inclusion
entry.content:
October CMS version prior to Build 437 contains a Local File Inclusion vulnerability in modules/system/traits/ViewMaker.php (makeFileContents function) that can result in Sensitive information disclosure and remote code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable remotely if the /backend path is accessible. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in Build 437.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-1999009
  • http://octobercms.com/support/article/rn-10
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v7cr-w5v6-6659

entry.title: [october/october] October CMS XSS
entry.content:
October CMS through 1.0.431 allows XSS by entering HTML on the Add Posts page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-7198
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/44144/
  • http://securitywarrior9.blogspot.com/2018/02/html-injection-october-cms.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-96mh-7xpr-qcgw

entry.title: [cockpit-hq/cockpit] Cockpit CMS Cross-Site Request Forgery vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) in the Admin portal of Cockpit CMS v2.5.2 allows attackers to execute arbitrary Administrator commands.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37650
  • https://github.com/Cockpit-HQ/Cockpit/releases/tag/2.6.0
  • https://www.ghostccamm.com/blog/multi_cockpit_vulns/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-45g2-r339-pjwf
